title: Document Databases: MongoDB and Flexible Schemas
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Document Databases: MongoDB and Flexible Schemas.

hook.text: A startup pivots its product every month. Each pivot changes what data it stores. Rigid SQL tables can't keep up.

buildup.text: Document databases like MongoDB store data as flexible JSON-like documents â€” no predefined schema required.

discovery.text: Each document can have different fields. Adding a new data attribute doesn't require altering the entire table.

twist.text: Schema flexibility became schema chaos â€” many MongoDB projects drowned in inconsistent, unvalidated data.

climax.text: MongoDB proved that flexibility matters, but also that some structure is necessary to prevent data entropy.

punchline.text: Freedom from schemas is liberating â€” until your data becomes a mess.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of document databases like MongoDB?
options: Flexible schemas that don't require predefined table structures
